Road Signage

Crosswalk

Description

Library

class library_qlabs_crosswalk.QLabsCrosswalk[source]

This class is for spawning crosswalks.

Constants

QLabsCrosswalk.ID_CROSSWALK = 10010

Class ID

Methods

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a crosswalk in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs.

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) See the configuration section for the available spawn configurations.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.spawn_degrees(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a crosswalk in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using degrees.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs.

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in degrees.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) See the configuration section for the available spawn configurations.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.destroy(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Destroys a crosswalk in an instance of QLabs.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

The number of actors destroyed. -1 if failed.

Return type

int32

QLabsCrosswalk.ping(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Checks if a crosswalk of the corresponding actor number exists in the QLabs environment.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

QLabsCrosswalk.get_world_transform(qlabs, actorNumber)[source]

Get the location, rotation, and scale in world coordinates of the crosswalk

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

Returns

success, location, rotation, scale

Return type

boolean, float array[3], float array[3], float array[3]

Configurations

Roundabout Sign

Description

Library

class library_qlabs_roundabout_sign.QLabsRoundaboutSign[source]

This class is for spawning roundabout signs.

Constants

QLabsRoundaboutSign.ID_ROUNDABOUT_SIGN = 10060

Class ID

Methods

QLabsRoundaboutSign.spawn(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a roundabout sign in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs.

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians.

  • scale – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in degrees.

  • scale – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

Description

Library

class library_qlabs_stop_sign.QLabsStopSign[source]

This class is for spawning stop signs.

Constants

QLabsStopSign.ID_STOP_SIGN = 10020

Class ID

Methods

QLabsStopSign.spawn(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a stop sign in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

This class is for spawning yield signs.

Class ID

Methods

QLabsYieldSign.spawn(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a yield sign in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Traffic Cone

Description

Library

class library_qlabs_traffic_cone.QLabsTrafficCone[source]

This class is for spawning traffic cones.

Constants

QLabsTrafficCone.ID_TRAFFIC_CONE = 10000

Class ID

Methods

QLabsTrafficCone.spawn(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a traffic cone in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs.

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) See the configuration section for the available spawn configurations.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

QLabsTrafficCone.spawn_degrees(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, configuration=0, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a traffic cone in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using degrees.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in degrees.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • configuration (uint32) – (Optional) See the configuration section for the available spawn configurations.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

0 if successful, 1 class not available, 2 actor number not available or already in use, 3 unknown error, -1 communications error

Return type

int32

Traffic Light

Description

Library

class library_qlabs_trafficlight.QLabsTrafficLight[source]

Constants

QLabsTrafficLight.ID_TRAFFIC_LIGHT = 10051

Class ID

QLabsTrafficLight.FCN_TRAFFIC_LIGHT_SET_STATE = 10
QLabsTrafficLight.FCN_TRAFFIC_LIGHT_SET_STATE_ACK = 11
QLabsTrafficLight.STATE_RED = 0

State constant for red light

QLabsTrafficLight.STATE_GREEN = 1

State constant for green light

QLabsTrafficLight.STATE_YELLOW = 2

State constant for yellow light

Methods

QLabsTrafficLight.spawn(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a stoplight in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs.

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

Danger

QLabsTrafficLight.spawn_degrees(qlabs, actorNumber, location, rotation, scale, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a stoplight in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using degrees.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in degrees.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the spawn before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

Danger

QLabsTrafficLight.set_state(qlabs, actorNumber, state, waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Set the light state (red/yellow/green) of a traffic light actor

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • actorNumber (uint32) – User defined unique identifier for the class actor in QLabs.

  • state (uint32) – An integer constant corresponding to a light state (see class constants)

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Wait for confirmation of the state change before proceeding. This makes the method a blocking operation.

Returns

True if spawn was successful, False otherwise

Return type

boolean
